intro: Odontotrichum radulifolium, commonly known as the radulifolium toothedweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white or greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has a taproot system and is often found in temperate regions of the northern hemisphere. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
